summary:
I’m the lead structural engineer for NAM’s 35 offshore gas platforms in the Dutch North Sea.

Managing these structures I’ve encountered a wide range of complex problems. Like our assets, these are spread across the operating lifecycle: installations, brownfield modifications, renewal campaigns, lifetime extensions and decommissioning. 

Throughout this, maintenance support with a focus on efficiency ensures continued safe production for the many ageing and late-life locations. 

I’m particularly excited to be working on major projects such as platform electrification which enable these structures to find a new value and relevance. 

I joined Shell through their graduate programme after graduating with a First in Engineering Science (MEng) from Oxford University.

treasury_media.title: 50 years of production in the Southern North Sea
treasury_media.description: The Leman gas field off the Norfolk coast has celebrated 50 years of production. The original platforms and Bacton gas terminal continue to produce energy for U.K. consumers.

treasury_media.title: Leman BH Decommissioning
treasury_media.description: Removal of the redundant BH platform was completed in June 2017. 97% of the structure was recycled in a new decommissioning yard established in East Anglia.

education.grade: International Baccalaureate: 43 out of 45. Maths(7), Physics(7), Chemistry (7)

projects.title: Extreme Waves in Hurricanes and Winter Storms
projects.description:
Master's project on Offshore Engineering and Data Analysis.
Working in Matlab, code was developed to process and analyse three data sets. By treating well studied hurricane wave records as a progression (rather than individual records), new findings were made on hurricane wave components.
A paper on the work is to be published in the Journal of Offshore Mechanical and Arctic Engineering.

profile_positions.description: Responsible for ensuring that the club's equipment and safety procedures were maintained. I completed a review of club safety. This resulted in equipment and information which had been neglected for many years being updated and improved. Following cases of interrupted training, I convinced the committee to purchase a new ampliﬁer for the boats. Using my understanding of individual priorities within the committee helped me to put forwards a strong case for this improvement. As a result, training for the lower 60% of the club was improved.
profile_positions.title: Health, Safety and Equipment Officer

profile_positions.description: As the elected treasurer of the boat club I was responsible for managing assets of £100,000 and a yearly turnover of £20,000. Initially faced with a deficit, my first action was to redesign the accounts and understand where money had been spent. This allowed me to identify savings and propose these to the committee. Working with my colleagues I was able to establish several new sources of income such as the Martlet Society for old members. By improving control of where money was sourced and spent I finished the year with a £3,000 surplus and a newly created investment fund to protect the club's long term survival.
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description: As housing representative I communicated undergraduate priorities to the college accommodation department. During major building works I ensured that the undergraduates were kept informed. I ran the housing ballot to house 270 undergraduates throughout the college, despite the impact that construction had had on the number of rooms available. As well as this I worked with the JCR committee to organise and run college events including freshers' week. I put forward and carried out several motions such as the renovation of the bicycle sheds.
profile_positions.title: Housing Rep

profile_positions.description: As captain I was solely responsible for all aspects of the club, from arranging matches to putting on social events. Initially faced with a shortage of players, encouraged new players into the sport and organized a new team kit. The team increased from 8 to 13 and enthusiasm rose. By the end of the year the team had been promoted into the ﬁrst league and reached the semi-ﬁnals of “Cuppers”.
profile_positions.title: Captain

profile_positions.description: I shadowed a senior engineer at the construction of a new UV water treatment unit. I attended several planning meetings which gave me an awareness of top level decision making. On the site I worked as part of a broad team of professionals. This experience into the operation of large engineering projects has helped me appreciate subsequent modules in project management and production. While at the site I used the knowledge that I had gained to help successfully diagnose faults in a filtration unit.
profile_positions.title: Placement

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Bath and West Show is a four day country fair aimed at "encouraging agriculture, arts, manufacture and commerce" in the South West. The event showcases local skills, educates on rural affairs and offers a large variety of entertainment.
As a Steward I am responsible for the Main Ring. I interact with both the public and professionals to ensure that the schedule of events is met.
In 2011 I jointly formed the Next Generation group to encourage involvement from the younger generations. The group now provides a network for 30 young adults who volunteer at the show.
In 2012 I was chosen to represent the Society in Zambia for the Royal Agricultural Society of the Commonwealth.
